casebody.data:
The Second Bank of Paterson, New Jersey, appellant, v. Alfred S. Dix, et al., respondents. Decided February 4, 1884. Appeal by plaintiff from judgment in favor of respondents Dix and Phyfe, entered on direction of judge at trial term, that the complaint be dismissed against them, and in favor of respondent Brown, on the verdict of the jury. Preston Stevertson, for appellant; Thomas J. Moore, for respondents Dix and Phyfe ; John Yard and Almon Goodwin, for respondent Brown.

Before Sedgwick, Ch. J., Truax and - O’Gorman, JJ.

Per Curiam.

Judgments affirmed, with costs for respondents severally.
